intro: Corniola microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved corniola, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually hairy. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Corniola microphylla is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates.
